lead_paragraph: In Ashton Hayes, residents have banded together to cut greenhouse emissions with solar panels, wine-and-cheese nights and no politicians.

headline.print_headline: An English Village Leads a Climate Revolution
headline.main: English Village Becomes Climate Leader by Quietly Cleaning Up Its Own Patch

snippet: In Ashton Hayes, residents have banded together to cut greenhouse emissions with solar panels, wine-and-cheese nights and no politicians....
abstract: Village of Ashton Hayes in England has become model for communities across world seeking to significantly reduce their greenhouse gas emissions without waiting for government to lead charge; village has accomplished 24 percent cut in emissions in 10 years, simply by convincing its residents to change their personal habits, and part of residents' success is due to fact that politicians have not been in charge.
